title: How to Draw a Billiards Ball

steps.headline: Draw a circle.
steps.description: You can add guidelines if you like, but you should be all right without them.

steps.headline: Draw a line where you want the middle of the ball to be.
steps.description: Try to have it curve along the line of the circle you drew in step 1.

steps.headline: Draw a horizontal line across the circle as well.
steps.description: The point at which the two lines overlap is where the number of the ball will be.

steps.headline: Sketch a smaller circle at the intersection of the lines.
steps.description: It should look the same as the first circle you drew, just a different size.

steps.headline: Draw two horizontal, slightly curved lines above and below the circle you made.
steps.description: This step is only for the billiard balls with numbers 9-15, however, so skip it if you're doing any of 1-8.

steps.headline: Ink in your drawing and erase the sketch lines.
steps.description: If you want you can draw a surface for the ball to be sitting on or add a shadow to make it look more real.

steps.headline: Color in your drawing according to the number you chose.
steps.description: For this tutorial, the 9 ball was used, so the coloring is primarily yellow with white on the top and bottom.

text: Draw a circle. You can add guidelines if you like, but you should be all right without them. Draw a line where you want the middle of the ball to be. Try to have it curve along the line of the circle you drew in step 1. Draw a horizontal line across the circle as well. The point at which the two lines overlap is where the number of the ball will be. Sketch a smaller circle at the intersection of the lines. It should look the same as the first circle you drew, just a different size. Draw two horizontal, slightly curved lines above and below the circle you made. This step is only for the billiard balls with numbers 9-15, however, so skip it if you're doing any of 1-8. Ink in your drawing and erase the sketch lines. If you want you can draw a surface for the ball to be sitting on or add a shadow to make it look more real. Color in your drawing according to the number you chose. For this tutorial, the 9 ball was used, so the coloring is primarily yellow with white on the top and bottom.
